Identification.LongTitle: Order Transferring to the Minister of National Revenue, the Powers, Duties and Functions of the Minister of Industry under the Tax Rebate Discounting Act

Provision.Text: Whereas the expression “Minister of Consumer and Corporate Affairs” in the definition Minister in subsection 2(1) of the Tax Rebate Discounting Act was replaced by the expression “Minister of Industry” pursuant to paragraph 62(1)(t) of the Department of Industry Act*, which Act was brought into force by Order in Council P.C. 1995-536 of March 29, 1995**;

Footnote.Text: SI/95-48, 1995 Canada Gazette Part II, p. 1013

Provision.Text: Therefore, His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to paragraph 2(a) of the Public Service Rearrangement and Transfer of Duties Act, is pleased hereby to transfer from the Minister of Industry to the Minister of National Revenue the powers, duties and functions of the Minister of Industry under the Tax Rebate Discounting Act.
